docs.snippet: Holders Spain crashed humiliatingly out of the World Cup on Wednesday after a second shock defeat while 2010 runners-up the Netherlands continued their perfect start with another high-scoring win.
docs.lead_paragraph: Holders Spain crashed humiliatingly out of the World Cup on Wednesday after a second shock defeat while 2010 runners-up the Netherlands continued their perfect start with another high-scoring win.

headline.main: Champions Spain Out of World Cup, Dutch March On
headline.print_headline: Champions Spain Out of World Cup, Dutch March On

docs.snippet: England manager Roy Hodgson expects prolific Uruguay striker Luis Suarez to return from injury and give the South Americans a much-needed boost when the teams meet in World Cup Group D on Thursday.
docs.lead_paragraph: England manager Roy Hodgson expects prolific Uruguay striker Luis Suarez to return from injury and give the South Americans a much-needed boost when the teams meet in World Cup Group D on Thursday.

headline.main: England Ready for Return of Suarez-Hodgson

docs.snippet: England winger Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain will miss the World Cup Group D match against Uruguay on Thursday as he continues his rehabilitation from a knee injury, manager Roy Hodgson said.
docs.lead_paragraph: England winger Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain will miss the World Cup Group D match against Uruguay on Thursday as he continues his rehabilitation from a knee injury, manager Roy Hodgson said.

headline.main: England's Oxlade-Chamberlain Out of Uruguay Match

docs.snippet: Cooler temperatures in Sao Paulo could help the England team when they meet Uruguay on Thursday, manager Roy Hodgson said, after the sapping heat and humidity of their first game in Manaus took its toll on the team.
docs.lead_paragraph: Cooler temperatures in Sao Paulo could help the England team when they meet Uruguay on Thursday, manager Roy Hodgson said, after the sapping heat and humidity of their first game in Manaus took its toll on the team.

headline.main: Cool Weather Could Help England, but Also Uruguay-Hodsgon
headline.print_headline: Cool Weather Could Help England, but Also Uruguay-Hodsgon

docs.snippet: Much of the focus ahead of England's World Cup Group D clash with Uruguay has been on the attacking talent set to light up the Corinthians arena on Thursday, but for English captain Steven Gerrard the game will be won and lost in defence.
docs.lead_paragraph: Much of the focus ahead of England's World Cup Group D clash with Uruguay has been on the attacking talent set to light up the Corinthians arena on Thursday, but for English captain Steven Gerrard the game will be won and lost in defence.

headline.main: Defence Will Win Uruguay Game, Says England's Gerrard
headline.print_headline: Defence Will Win Uruguay Game, Says England's Gerrard

docs.snippet: Here’s what you need to know to start your day.
docs.lead_paragraph: Here’s what you need to know to start your day.

docs.snippet: Big business and big government are inextricably linked in ways that fans of free markets may not like but can’t really avoid.
docs.lead_paragraph: Big business and big government are inextricably linked in ways that fans of free markets may not like but can’t really avoid.
docs.abstract: The Upshot; debate over Export-Import Bank of United States, finance provider for American exports, offers look into how modern economies really work, and the ways big business and big government are inevitably intertwined in ways that fans of free markets may not like--but may not be able to avoid.

headline.main: Why We’re All Crony Capitalists, Like It or Not
headline.print_headline: Crony Capitalism, a Fact of Modern Economies

docs.snippet: Luis Suarez scored twice for Uruguay, including the game-winning goal in the 84th minute, in a 2-1 victory against England, who is all but mathematically eliminated now.
